member.name: T:SimpleML.IHypothesisCalculator
member.summary: Defines methods to calculate the result of a hypothesis function.

member.name: M:SimpleML.IHypothesisCalculator.Calculate(SimpleML.Matrix,SimpleML.Matrix)
member.summary: Calculates the result of a hypothesis function.
member.param: The data series used in evaluating the hypothesis, stored column-wise in a matrix.
The parameter values of the hypothesis, stored column-wise in a matrix.
member.returns: A matrix containing a single column containing the hypothesis evaluation for each item in the data series (the 'm' dimension of the resulting matrix should match the 'm' dimension of the 'dataSeries' parameter).

member.name: T:SimpleML.ICostFunctionCalculator
member.summary: Defines methods to calculate the basic cost of a function given specific input data and theta parameters.

member.name: M:SimpleML.ICostFunctionCalculator.Calculate(SimpleML.Containers.Matrix,SimpleML.Containers.Matrix,SimpleML.Containers.Matrix)
member.summary: Calculates the cost using the specified data series and theta parameters.
member.param: The data series, stored column-wise in a matrix.
The data results, stored as a single column matrix.
The theta parameter values to use in the cost calculation, stored as a single column matrix.

member.name: T:SimpleML.ICostFunctionGradientCalculator
member.summary: Defines methods to calculate the cost and gradients of a function given specific input data, theta parameters, and a regularization parameter.

member.name: M:SimpleML.ICostFunctionGradientCalculator.Calculate(SimpleML.Containers.Matrix,SimpleML.Containers.Matrix,SimpleML.Containers.Matrix,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the cost and gradients, using the specified data series, theta parameters, and regularization parameter.
member.param: The data series, stored column-wise in a matrix.
The data results, stored as a single column matrix.
The theta parameter values to use in the cost calculation, stored as a single column matrix.
member.returns: A tuple containing the cost as a Double, and a Matrix containing the gradients for each theta parameter (stored column-wise).
